authors: Ilia Kuznetsov, Osama Mahammed Afzal, Koen Dercksen, Nils Dycke, Alexander Goldberg, Tom Hope, Dirk Hovy, Jonathan K. Kummerfeld, Anne Lauscher, Kevin Leyton-Brown, Sheng Lu, Mausam, Margot Mieskes, Aurelie Neveol, Danish Pruthi, Lizhen Qu, Roy Schwartz, Noah A. Smith, Thamar Solorio, Jingyan Wang, Xiaodan Zhu, Anna Rogers, Nihar B. Shah, Iryna Gurevych
title: What can natural language processing do for peer review?
description: This paper was a result of the Dagstuhl seminar on peer review held in 2024. It provides an overview of the current state of peer review and where NLP techniques might interfere to improve the process.

authors: K. Dercksen, A.P. de Vries, B. van Ginneken
title: SimpleRad: patient-friendly Dutch radiology reports
description: SimpleRad is a tool for entity linking, summarization and finding prevalence estimation in Dutch radiology reports.

authors: J.M. van Hulst, F. Hasibi, K. Dercksen, K. Balog, A. P. de Vries
title: REL: an entity linker standing on the shoulders of giants
description: REL (Radboud Entity Linker) is a modular entity linking framework based on state-of-the-art neural components. Code is available for local deployment. A web API is available as well.

authors: V. Provatorova, S. Vakulenko, E. Kanoulas, K. Dercksen, J.M. van Hulst
title: Named entity recognition and linking on historical newspapers: UvA. ILPS & REL at CLEF HIPE 2020
description: Paper describing our submission to the CLEF HIPE 2020 shared task on identifying named entities in multi-lingual historical newspapers in French, German and English.

title: First steps towards patient-friendly presentation of Dutch radiology reports
description: Paper describing our initial efforts towards patient-friendly Dutch radiology reports. Primarily on entity linking annotation and future work.

authors: T. Schoegje, C. Kamphuis, K. Dercksen, D. Hiemstra, T. Pieters, A. P. de Vries
title: Exploring task-based query expansion at the TREC-COVID track
description: Exploring how to generate effective queries based on search tasks for the TREC-COVID track.

authors: K. Dercksen, M. Kallenberg, J. Kroes
title: Robust multi-vendor breast region segmentation using deep learning
description: This paper investigates a robust multi-vendor breast region segmentation system for full field digital mammograms and digital breast tomography using a U-Net neural network.

authors: K. Dercksen, W. Bulten, G. Litjens
title: Dealing with label scarcity in computational pathology: a use case in prostate cancer classification
description: This paper investigates the performance of unsupervised and supervised deep learning methods for prostate cancer classification when few labelled data are available.
